questions.question: I have the ………………………. to visit New Zealand next month.
There is a/an …………………………. of my visiting New Zealand next month.
questions.description: We say there is a possibility of something happening.

questions.question: She drove off in the ………………………...
questions.description: We put opposite before a noun to talk about one of a pair of things that naturally face each other.

questions.question: My brother is playing on the ………………………….
questions.description: We put opposite before a noun to talk about one of a pair of things that naturally face each other.

questions.question: Suddenly I noticed that the …………………………. was staring at me.
questions.description: We put opposite after the noun when it means ‘facing the speaker’.

questions.question: I can read your mind like an ……………………….. book.
questions.description: We use open as the adjective. The past participle opened is not used as an adjective.

questions.question: Is the bank ……………………… on Saturdays?
questions.description: We use open as the adjective.

questions.question: I cannot …………………………… this shoelace?
questions.description: We do not normally use open to talk about the unfastening of clothes.  Instead we use untie or undo.

questions.question: Who left the taps …………………………?
questions.description: We do not normally use open with switches and taps.

questions.question: One of my ………………………. is an actor.
questions.description: After one of, we need a plural noun.

questions.question: One of our pigs …………………………. disappeared.
questions.description: The verb is singular after one of.

questions.question: I ……………………………yesterday when I was hiking.
questions.description: We do not use ‘often’ to mean ‘frequently on the same occasion’.
